text: I inject a service into a controller. I want the service to be shut down when exiting the controller. What should I do?

I gather I either do it manually from the controller’s `willDestroy` or the service should do it on its own `willDestroy`, which hopefully is called by the default implementation of `Controller#willDestroy`. Is that correct?
controllers are singletons so they won't be destroyed until the app is destroyed - is that the behaviour you're trying to hook into?
hm, I thought they were singletons in 1.x, but stopped being in 2.x?
I may have misunderstood that part

they are still singletons, I believe routable-components will get rid of that. If you want to shut down the service when exiting a screen you probably want to use the associated route's `deactivate` hook to call a method on the controller/service
right. OK, will try that. Thanks!
